001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import java.util.Collections;
008import java.util.HashSet;
009import java.util.Set;
010
011/**
012 * A CommandGroup that runs a set of commands in parallel, ending when any one of the commands ends
013 * and interrupting all the others.
014 *
015 * <p>As a rule, CommandGroups require the union of the requirements of their component commands.
016 *
017 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
018 */
019public class ParallelRaceGroup extends CommandGroupBase {
020  private final Set<Command> m_commands = new HashSet<>();
021  private boolean m_runWhenDisabled = true;
022  private boolean m_finished = true;
023  private InterruptionBehavior m_interruptBehavior = InterruptionBehavior.kCancelIncoming;
024
025  /**
026   * Creates a new ParallelCommandRace. The given commands will be executed simultaneously, and will
027   * "race to the finish" - the first command to finish ends the entire command, with all other
028   * commands being interrupted.
029   *
030   * @param commands the commands to include in this group.
031   */
032  public ParallelRaceGroup(Command... commands) {
033    addCommands(commands);
034  }
035
036  @Override
037  public final void addCommands(Command... commands) {
038    requireUngrouped(commands);
039
040    if (!m_finished) {
041      throw new IllegalStateException(
042          "Commands cannot be added to a CommandGroup while the group is running");
043    }
044
045    registerGroupedCommands(commands);
046
047    for (Command command : commands) {
048      if (!Collections.disjoint(command.getRequirements(), m_requirements)) {
049        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
050            "Multiple commands in a parallel group cannot" + " require the same subsystems");
051      }
052      m_commands.add(command);
053      m_requirements.addAll(command.getRequirements());
054      m_runWhenDisabled &= command.runsWhenDisabled();
055      if (command.getInterruptionBehavior() == InterruptionBehavior.kCancelSelf) {
056        m_interruptBehavior = InterruptionBehavior.kCancelSelf;
057      }
058    }
059  }
060
061  @Override
062  public final void initialize() {
063    m_finished = false;
064    for (Command command : m_commands) {
065      command.initialize();
066    }
067  }
068
069  @Override
070  public final void execute() {
071    for (Command command : m_commands) {
072      command.execute();
073      if (command.isFinished()) {
074        m_finished = true;
075      }
076    }
077  }
078
079  @Override
080  public final void end(boolean interrupted) {
081    for (Command command : m_commands) {
082      command.end(!command.isFinished());
083    }
084  }
085
086  @Override
087  public final boolean isFinished() {
088    return m_finished;
089  }
090
091  @Override
092  public boolean runsWhenDisabled() {
093    return m_runWhenDisabled;
094  }
095
096  @Override
097  public InterruptionBehavior getInterruptionBehavior() {
098    return m_interruptBehavior;
099  }
100}
